channel.title: Moscow on Rusland 1
channel.description: Recent content in Moscow on Rusland 1

item.title: Photo: Igor Mukhin
item.description: “I felt that the time of ‘change’ had come, and I needed to go and shoot” (Flashbak, 2018). To start: explore Igor Mukhin’s work in the series Смотри в тишине (Look in silence). Presented by MAMM (= Multimedia Art Museum, Moscow).

item.title: 25/17 3x
item.description: 25/17 is/was Ant (Ant) or Anton Zavyalov (1982) and Bledny (Pale) or Andrey Pozdnukhov (1976). Подорожник (Plantain) (2014) From the album Русский подорожник (Russian plantain). Featuring Dmitry Revyakin (= Dmitry Revyakin), from Kalinov Most (= Kalinov Most). Performed again in 2020 on Evening Urgant; see the playlist Music Performances.

item.title: ЛЮТИК – 7 whisky-colas and Tired of Drinking
item.description: 7 виски кол Whisky-cola, for example. It starts with two and quickly moves to five. It doesn’t stop there, nor at the seven mentioned in the title. I’m having so much fun (мне так весело) – I hope I forget everything (надеюсь всё забуду) as soon as I get home (как только я зайду в свой дом).

item.title: Skverna – Butovo & Привет красавица
item.description: There isn’t much more to say about Skverna (also Скверна, but not to be confused with this). The number of views on their YouTube channel would be higher if only their mothers checked it out once a month. Too bad for those moms.

item.title: Mother of God on the Moat: St. Basil’s Cathedral
item.description: Ivan IV Built to commemorate the Conquest of Kazan on the orders of Ivan IV (1530-1584), better known as the Terrible or Грозный. While the name translates to “terrible,” it’s a bit exaggerated – as a character sketch, it’s still mild.

item.title: Зарница – I Wanna Pet Your Dog (Корги)
item.description: Also features a reference to The Cure. Or at least, a record (пластинка) of theirs. Иди за мной, Я приведу тебя туда, Где я и ты, пластинка Cure, и нам больше некуда спешить Zarnitsa A зарница (zarnitsa) is heat lightning, but the term also has (Soviet) historical significance; see Wikipedia in English or Russian.

item.title: Хадн дадн – 900 rubles & home today (Мы сегодня дома)
item.description: So, there’s nothing revolutionary in the title and no drama. The musical arrangement, performance, lyrical scope, and variation: on all these fronts, it’s more restrained than exuberant. It’s almost fragile. But then/then again. И дорога луной озарилась вся Мы с тобой никогда не поссоримся И ладонь на слои распадается И асфальт под ногой уменьшается

item.title: Louna 3x
item.description: Beginning of a new circle Louna has a new album (October 2020), Начало нового круга (Beginning of a New Circle). It includes Станем стеной, Кто мы? (with Anacondaz), Из этих стен (recorded during the pandemic), and this Сигнал в пустоте (Signal in the Void).

item.title: Казускома 4x
item.description: The selection was heavily influenced by what could be embedded. As a result, the regrettable omission here includes Я не могу (I Can’t, 2019), Твой рот (Your Mouth, 2018), and Электрический Волк (Electric Wolf, 2018). These ones could be included and they are not bad either.

item.title: Тараканы! 3x
item.description: Engagement Lyrically and thematically, Тараканы! is your classic punk(rock) band. Watch and listen to Дезертир из армии зла (Deserter from the army of evil, 2019), Ни рыбы, ни мяса (Neither fish nor fowl, 2018), Я не верю (I don’t believe), Что я могу изменить?

item.title: Korsika – Rage
item.description: Text Korsika (or KORSИKA) is from Moscow, has been active since 2007, and keeps going strong. Learn more about Korsika (or Kорсика) on Wikipedia (RU) and their official website. More words for rage in Russian vocabulary about ANGER | Злые слова (Ru-Land Club, 2020, 12 m).

item.title: Davie504 in Moscow
item.description: Davie’s small tour through Moscow (2019, 3 m) is worth watching, but you can only see it on YouTube. From a year earlier is When you’re a bassist but you visited Russia once (2018, 2 m). Featuring ushanka, the Russian national anthem, сука блят, and vodka.

item.title: Pasosh – Stop, Max
item.description: So stop, Макс. Макс? Ма-а-акс! (Lyrics) More about Pasosh / Пасош (from Moscow) on Wikipedia, Bandcamp, Facebook, Instagram, VK, and their website. Most of the music here is also in an R1 playlist on YouTube (in order of release).

item.title: Vólan – The Beginning (Начало)
item.description: theater closed, actors dismissed, I cannot retrieve what is lost. the final act and the curtain falls, farewell, world of illusions, I begin anew. (Lyrics) More Vólan (Moscow) on Bandcamp and VK.
